message.content:
cs.DC, cs.DS, cs.SY, cs.IT, cs.NI

Reasoning: 
- cs.DC (Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing) is the most likely category as the paper explores the feasibility of implementing a distributed storage system on a commodity computing cluster.
- cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms) is also likely as the paper discusses the use of erasure coding with LDPC codes for file distribution across storage nodes.
- cs.SY (Systems and Control) is a possible category as the paper presents performance measurements of a prototype system comprising 50 nodes which are self-organised using a peer-to-peer overlay.
- cs.IT (Information Theory) is another possible category as the paper mentions the use of LDPC codes for high reliability while keeping storage and performance overhead small.
- cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture) is a less likely category but still possible as the paper discusses the use of a peer-to-peer overlay for self-organisation of the storage nodes.
